author: Geo Hugokare

text:
So Classic and Legends are the exact same game then?
For arguments sake, even if MM was the most stagnant IP ever, is being the grand dad of a genre a good reason for it to sell? Because it was first? As to each incarnation of the same game being different, that doesn't work when they always...ALWAYS have the one ultimate version eventually released with all the characters, stages, modes, etc. What's the point of buying all the other versions if they'll eventually all be on one thing later?
author: Arc13

text: Street Fighter is the grand-dad of an entire genre. Of course it's going to get love, especially since it's just selling. Not to mention each individual incarnation is worth playing and different. Megaman is varied? It's probably the most stagnant IP ever.
author: goodbye

text:
When I saw the Dragon's Dogma Teaser site a while back.. With the Dragon shape and the beating heart.. 
You wouldn't believe how excited I was thinking it might become a new Breath of Fire!
But alas. 
Dragon's Dogma is a fantastic game. But what I wouldn't give to see an all new current gen BoF reboot...

text:
Megaman's earned. Plus his games have variety to them. What's truly annoying is Street Fighter. Making different versions in which honestly the differences are the speed and remix some tunes. Add a character that you fought but didn't play or someone from a past game. 42 versions of Street Fighter II.
C'mon.
